faqs.question: What is the Cloud Computing Cell (CCC)?
faqs.answer: The Cloud Computing Cell (CCC) is the official technical society of the IT Department at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College. Established in 2016, CCC focuses on cloud technologies, web development, ML, UI/UX, and hands-on technical skills through events, workshops, and projects.

faqs.question: How can I join the Cloud Computing Cell?
faqs.answer: Students can join CCC by participating in the annual recruitment drive conducted by the society. The process typically involves a registration form, a technical or creative assessment, and an interview round to evaluate your skills and interest. It will be held in the starting of third semester.

faqs.question: Who can be a member of CCC?
faqs.answer: CCC is open to students from all branches and years who have an interest in technology, cloud computing, web development, machine learning, or design. second-year and second-year students are especially encouraged to apply.

faqs.question: What activities does CCC organize?
faqs.answer: CCC organizes workshops, tech events, hands-on sessions, competitions, and project-based learning programs. Some of the major events include DevClash, Nimbus, TechBuzz, CloudSplore, and React-ion.

faqs.question: Who coordinates the Cloud Computing Cell?
faqs.answer: CCC is coordinated by Mr. Santosh Kumar Mishra and Ms. Shikha Agrawal from the IT Department. They guide students in technical learning, project development, and professional growth.

faqs.question: What domains does CCC focus on?
faqs.answer: CCC covers multiple technology domains including Web Development, Mobile App Development, UI/UX Design, Cloud Computing, and Machine Learning. Each domain offers practical learning through projects and workshops.

faqs.question: Does CCC provide hands-on learning?
faqs.answer: Yes, CCC emphasizes practical learning through real-world projects, cloud deployments, workshops, coding tasks, and collaborative team activities. Students work on technologies like GitHub, Python, CloudStack, Docker, and more.

faqs.question: Is there any fee to join CCC?
faqs.answer: No, CCC membership is completely free. The society aims to provide skill development opportunities without any financial cost.

faqs.question: Can second-year students join CCC?
faqs.answer: No, from second-year students are welcome and encouraged to join CCC. Many workshops and events are beginner-friendly and tailored for new students.

faqs.question: Where can I find updates about CCC events?
faqs.answer: You can find all updates on CCCâ€™s official website, social media profiles, or through announcements made by the society during college events.

society_info.name: Cloud Computing Cell
society_info.introduction: The Cloud Computing Cell, the technical society of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College, has been active since February 2016. It exposes students to the latest cloud technologies, preparing them for industry and research opportunities. The Cell enables students to compute, manage, and deploy cloud-based solutions while gaining hands-on experience through real-world implementations. It is coordinated by Mr. Santosh Kumar Mishra and Ms. Shikha Agrawal from the IT Department.
society_info.about_us: The Cloud Computing Cell at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College, established in February 2016, provides students with exposure to modern cloud technologies, improving their readiness for placements and research. It offers a platform to learn, manage, and deploy cloud services. The Cell is guided by Mr. Santosh Kumar Mishra and Ms. Shikha Agrawal from the IT Department, who mentor students in both academic and professional domains.
society_info.who_we_are: We are a vibrant team of individuals from diverse backgrounds with a shared passion for technology. Our members collaborate to explore and innovate in Web Development, Machine Learning, Cloud Computing, and UI/UX Design. Through teamwork, knowledge sharing, and hands-on projects, we aim to empower every member to grow and achieve their full potential in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.

domains.details: Web development involves building everything from simple static pages to complex web applications interacting with databases and users in real-time. It includes HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and backend frameworks like Node.js, Django, and Ruby on Rails. Web developers design digital experiences that are functional, responsive, and visually appealing.

Mobile app development focuses on creating applications for iOS and Android devices. Developers build tools, services, games, and interactive applications that allow users to engage on-the-go. With millions of mobile users worldwide, app development is one of the most in-demand and impactful tech skill areas.

UI/UX design focuses on creating visually appealing interfaces and intuitive user experiences. It ensures products are easy to navigate, consistent, accessible, and optimized for user needs. Strong UI/UX design is essential for building impactful and user-friendly digital products.

Cloud computing enables companies to store data and run applications on remote servers rather than on traditional on-site hardware. It provides scalable, cost-effective, and efficient solutions while improving collaboration and flexibility. Cloud technologies also integrate with fields like IoT, Big Data, and AI, forming the backbone of modern computing.

Machine Learning focuses on building systems that learn from data and make intelligent decisions. It includes concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, neural networks, and model evaluation. ML is used in real-world applications like recommendation systems, fraud detection, natural language processing, and computer vision. By working on ML projects, students gain hands-on experience in data preprocessing, model training, deployment, and understanding how intelligent systems operate.

faculty.name: Mr. Santosh Mishra
faculty.description: Gold Faculty Partner at Infosys with 15+ years of teaching and 3 years of industry experience. Skilled in Java, C, C++, Python, PHP.

faculty.name: Ms. Shikha Agrawal
faculty.description: Gold Faculty Partner at Infosys with 15+ years of teaching and 3 years of industry experience. Skilled in Java, C, C++, Python, PHP.

events.name: DEVCLASH
events.content: The Cloud Computing Cell, the technical society under the IT Department, successfully organized DevClash, an event designed exclusively for 2nd-year students to showcase their front-end development skills in web and app development.

events.name: CLOUDSPLORE
events.content: The Cloud Computing Cell conducted a workshop from 28th to 29th April 2022 titled CloudSplore. The workshop was conducted under the guidance of Dr. Parneet Kaur and Dr. Abhilasha Singh.

events.name: REACT-ION
events.content: Cloud Computing Cell conducted a hands-on workshop named React-ion, focusing on fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and React frameworks.

events.name: NIMBUS
events.content: The Cloud Computing Cell successfully conducted NIMBUS, a hands-on introductory workshop covering Git & GitHub, Cloud Computing, Python Programming, Docker, and Machine Learning.

events.name: TECHBUZZ
events.content: The Cloud Computing Cell successfully organized TechBuzz, an insightful event featuring Rohit Negi, a renowned YouTuber, tech enthusiast, and industry expert.
